content:
IApplicationPreloadManager Interface

Definition

Provides methods that ASP.NET uses to invoke the application-preload feature in IIS 7.0.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("AE54F424-71BC-4da5-AA2F-8C0CD53496FC")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
public interface IApplicationPreloadManager

Methods

SetApplicationPreloadState(String,String,Boolean)

Called by IIS 7.0 to notify ASP.NET whether an application should be preloaded.

public void SetApplicationPreloadState (string context, string appId, bool enabled);
context
String

The application context.

appId
String

The unique ID of the application.

enabled
Boolean

true to indicate that the application should be preloaded; otherwise, false.

SetApplicationPreloadUtil(IApplicationPreloadUtil)

Calls IIS 7.0 to get information that is required in order to preload an application.

public void SetApplicationPreloadUtil (System.Web.Hosting.IApplicationPreloadUtil preloadUtil);
preloadUtil
IApplicationPreloadUtil

The handle to an unmanaged interface in IIS 7.0 that ASP.NET calls to get information.

Remarks

IIS calls ASP.NET through this interface, supplying a reference to an object that implements the IApplicationPreloadUtil interface. ASP.NET uses that interface later to perform a callback into IIS to get preload information for individual applications.
